The value of {{c|std::numeric_limits&lt;T&gt;::is_bounded}} is {{c|true}} for all arithmetic types {{tt|T}} that represent a finite set of values. While all fundamental types are bounded, this constant would be {{c|false}} in a specialization of {{lc|std::numeric_limits}} for a library-provided arbitrary precision arithmetic type.
